references.title: A. Miniukovich and A. De Angeli (2015). Computation of Interface Aesthetics. CHI'15: Proceedings of the 33rd Annual ACM Conference on Human Factor in Computing Systems, pp. 1163-1172.

x1.name: Aesthetic rating score by Webthetics
x1.description: A deep neural network model to automatically evaluate and quantify aesthetics of the input webpage.

references.title: Q. Dou, X. S. Zheng, T. Sun, P-A. Heng (2019). Webthetics: Quantifying Webpage Aesthetics with Deep Learning. International Journal of Human-Computer Studies 124, pp. 56-66.

results.name: Aesthetic rating score by Webthetics
results.description: The score range is from 1 to 9, where 1 indicates the least appealing and 9 the most appealing

p3.name: Website Aesthetics Evaluation by Calista
p3.description: A comparison-based deep learning system which automatically assess website aesthetics.

references.title: A. Delitzas, K. C. Chatzidimitriou, and A. L. Symeonidis (2023). Calista: A deep learning-based system for understanding and evaluating website aesthetics. International Journal of Human-Computer Studies, vol. 175, July 2023, 103019.
